links.title: Lex: '2018 Is When Tesla's Wheels Should Come Off'
links.description: A Tesla Model S Losing A Wheel (Image via Hybrid Cars) Wednesday's news that Tesla's ( TSLA) Q4 Model 3 deliveries fell short of estimates called to mind Saturday's Financial Times Lex column on the company (paywalled here). In that column, Lex started with an ominous prediction tied to problems with Model 3 deliveries, before adding some equivocation.

links.title: Tesla Stock As An Investment 2018
links.description: Tesla Stock can rally significantly higher, but Tesla is currently a battleground stock. There is an on going battle between billionaire's and a massive $12 billion dollar short position in Tesla. So far short sellers have been completely wrong and they have had their accounts blown up :) Where do you think Tesla stock is headed?

links.title: Pressures mount for BMW as Tesla continues to lead US large luxury car market
links.description: It's a little early to predict that Tesla will drive the giant global automakers, one by one, into bankruptcy. However, there's no question that some brands are already feeling the shockwaves from the electric automaker's rise, especially in certain market segments. Every automaker has its own mix of products, so the companies have varying degrees ...

$TSLA put your $ where your air is. Oceans are going anaerobic from CO2 concentrations & temperature rise. https://serc.si.edu/media/press-release/ocean-losing-its-breath-heres-global-scope

links.title: The Ocean Is Losing Its Breath. Here's the Global Scope.
links.description: In the past 50 years, the amount of water in the open ocean with zero oxygen has gone up more than fourfold. In coastal water bodies, including estuaries and seas, low-oxygen sites have increased more than 10-fold since 1950.
